title: Gallic War 6 13 - Druids as judges - Set 2

content.question: Illi rebus divinis intersunt, sacrificia publica ac privata procurant, religiones interpretantur: ad hos magnus adulescentium numerus disciplinae causa concurrit, magnoque hi sunt apud eos honore. Nam fere de omnibus controversiis publicis privatisque constituunt et, si quod est admissum facinus, si caedes facta, si de 5hereditate, de finibus controversia est, idem decernunt, praemia poenasque constituunt; si qui aut privatus aut populus eorum decreto non stetit, sacrificiis interdicunt. Bellum Gallicum 6. 13 Answer the following questions in English unless the question specifically asks you to write out Latin words. Number your answer to each question. 1. (A) What are the case and number of sacrificia (line 1) and (B) which two adjectives modify it? 2. (A) To which Latin word in this passage do hos (line 2) and hi (line 3) refer? (B) Translate it in context. 3. In lines 1-3 (Illi . . . honore), which two Latin words mean that the Druids are highly regarded? 4. In lines 3-7 (Nam . . . interdicunt), which two Latin words can be translated “murder has been committed”? 5. (A) Identify the type of clause illustrated by si de hereditate . . . controversia est (lines 4-5) and (B) translate it in context. 6. In lines 3-7 (Nam . . . interdicunt), which two different verbs can be translated “they determine”? 7. (A) Which Latin word in this passage is the subject of stetit (line 6) ? (B) Translate the subject in context. 8. In this passage, (A) which two Latin words identify the Druids’ punishment for people who do not follow their rulings? (B) Translate them in context. 9. (A) What political officer in the Roman Republic would preside over court cases and oversee judgments and (B) what was the name of the type of building where this would typically occur?
